snippet: The residents of the town of Marea had already survived crackdowns, tanks, infantry attacks, airstrikes and cluster munitions. But something about an attack this summer was different.

byline.contributor: Karam Shoumali contributed reporting from Gaziantep; Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon; and Eric Schmitt from Washington.

abstract: Family of rebel fighter Abu Anas Ishara has suffered ravages of August 21 chemical attack by Islamic State in Marea, Syria; insurgents have revived brutal form of warfare little used since passage of Convention on Chemical Weapons; evidence collected over several months has led some analysts to conclude that ISIS has developed, and is deploying, small-scale chemical weapons program.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The residents of the town of Marea had already survived crackdowns, tanks, infantry attacks, airstrikes and cluster munitions. But something about an attack this summer was different.

headline.print_headline: What an ISIS Chemical Strike Did to One Family
headline.main: What an ISIS Chemical Strike Did to One Syrian Family
